title: Replace login/sign-in page image with uploaded JPEG

requirements.text: Add the user-uploaded image file (WhatsApp-Image-2020-10-24-at-11.11.10-PM-2.jpeg) to the frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated as a properly sized login/sign-in logo image, and ensure it is the only image used on the login/sign-in screen.

quotes: replace existing image on login page and logo on sign in by this image

acceptanceCriteria: A new static asset exists under frontend/public/assets/generated derived from WhatsApp-Image-2020-10-24-at-11.11.10-PM-2.jpeg and is suitable for use as a logo (square/contained, not distorted).
No UI on the login/sign-in screen references the old login image asset anymore (e.g., /assets/generated/auth-image.dim_512x512.jpeg is no longer used on that screen).

requirements.text: Update the unauthenticated login/sign-in UI in frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.tsx to display the uploaded image (from frontend/public/assets/generated) in place of the current logo image, and update the alt text to a generic English description (do not use a person’s name).

quotes: replace existing image on login page and logo on sign in by this image

acceptanceCriteria: When logged out (no identity), the logo shown above the title in the sign-in card is the uploaded image.
The alt text is in English and is generic (e.g., "Login logo"), and does not contain a real person’s name.
The sign-in page renders without broken image links in both local and deployed builds.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep backend logic unchanged (this is a frontend asset/UI change only).
nonGoals: Do not change the header logo in the authenticated AppShell header (frontend/src/components/layout/AppShell.tsx).
Do not add new authentication providers or change Internet Identity behavior.
